intro: Xylosma congesta var. kwangtungensis, commonly known as the Kwangtung xylosma, is a shrub or small tree native to southern China. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks.
